009package imagingbook.common.geometry.basic;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
015
016public abstract class PntUtils {
017        
018        private PntUtils() {}
019        
020        /**
021         * Calculates and returns the centroid of the specified
022         * point set.
023         * @param pts an {@link Iterable} of {@link Pnt2d} instances
024         * @return the centroid (as a {@link Pnt2d} instance)
025         */
026        public static Pnt2d centroid(Iterable<Pnt2d> pts) {
027                double sx = 0;
028                double sy = 0;
029                int n = 0;
030                for (Pnt2d p : pts) {
031                        sx = sx + p.getX();
032                        sy = sy + p.getY();
033                        n++;
034                }
035                if (n == 0) {
036                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least one point is required for centroid calculation");
037                }
038                return Pnt2d.from(sx/n, sy/n);
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Calculates and returns the centroid of the specified
043         * point set.
044         * @param pts an array of {@link Pnt2d} instances
045         * @return the centroid (as a {@link Pnt2d} instance)
046         */
047        public static Pnt2d centroid(Pnt2d[] pts) {
048                return centroid(() -> Arrays.stream(pts).iterator());
049        }
050        
051        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
052        
053        /**
054         * Converts a given point array {@code Pnt2d[n]} to a 2D double array {@code double[n][2]},
055         * with x-coordinates in column 0 and y-coordinates in column 1.
056         * @param pts the point array
057         * @return a 2D double array
058         */
059        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(Pnt2d[] pts) {
060                final int n = pts.length;
061                double[][] pa = new double[n][2];
062                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
063                        pa[i][0] = pts[i].getX();
064                        pa[i][1] = pts[i].getY();
065                }
066                return pa;
067        }
068        
069        /**
070         * Converts a given 2D double array {@code double[n][2]} to a point array {@code Pnt2d[n]},
071         * taking x-coordinates from column 0 and y-coordinates from column 1.
072         * @param da a 2D double array 
073         * @return a point array
074         */
075        public static Pnt2d[] fromDoubleArray(double[][] da) {
076                final int n = da.length;
077                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
078                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
079                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.from(da[i]);
080                }
081                return pts;
082        }
083        
084        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
085        
086        /**
087         * Creates and returns an array of {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} points from the
088         * given sequence of {@code int} coordinate values, interpreted as x/y
089         * pairs. Throws an exception if the length of the coordinate sequence
090         * is not even. Usage example:
091         * <pre>
092         * Pnt2d[] pts = PntUtils.makeIntPoints(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6);
093         *    // gives [PntInt(1, 2), PntInt(3, 4), PntInt(5, 6)]
094         * </pre>
095         * 
096         * @param xy an even-numbered sequence of point coordinates
097         * @return an array of {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} points
098         */
099        public static Pnt2d[] makeIntPoints(int... xy) {
100                if (xy.length % 2 != 0) {
101                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("even number of point coordinates required");
102                }
103                final int n = xy.length/2;
104                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
105                for (int i = 0, j = 0; i < n; i++, j += 2) {
106                        pts[i] = new PntInt(xy[j], xy[j + 1]);
107                }
108                return pts;
109        }
110        
111        /**
112         * Creates and returns an array of {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} points from the
113         * given sequence of {@code double} coordinate values, interpreted as x/y
114         * pairs. Throws an exception if the length of the coordinate sequence
115         * is not even. Usage example:
116         * <pre>
117         * Pnt2d[] pts = PntUtils.makeDoublePoints(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6);
118         * // gives [PntDouble(1.0, 2.0), PntDouble(3.0, 4.0), PntDouble(5.0, 6.0)]
119         * </pre>
120         * 
121         * @param xy an even-numbered sequence of point coordinates
122         * @return an array of {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} points
123         */
124        public static Pnt2d[] makeDoublePoints(double... xy) {
125                if (xy.length % 2 != 0) {
126                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("even number of point coordinates required");
127                }
128                final int n = xy.length/2;
129                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
130                for (int i = 0, j = 0; i < n; i++, j += 2) {
131                        pts[i] = new PntDouble(xy[j], xy[j + 1]);
132                }
133                return pts;
134        }
135        
136}
